name: onApplicationEnd
description: Defined in Application.cfc, invoked when the application times out or when the server is shutting down.

params.name: ApplicationScope
params.description: The application scope of the application that is ending.

examples.title: Write to log when onApplicationEnd is triggered
examples.description: Write to the log that application has ended
examples.code:
<cfscript>
public void function onApplicationEnd(struct ApplicationScope){

		var logFile = FileOpen("D:\CF\logs\application.log", "append");
		FileWriteLine(logFile,"#arguments.ApplicationScope.name# ended on: #now()#");
		FileClose(logFile);
		return true;
	}
</cfscript>
examples.result: Text myApp ended on {current date/time} gets added to D:\CF\logs\myApp.log file. Note: Application has already ended, but we can use ApplicationScope argument to access any Application scope variables.
